user.title: PowerSync Setup
user.description: Configure PowerSync to automatically sync electricity pricing to your battery system.

provider_selection.title: Select Electricity Provider
provider_selection.description:
Choose your electricity provider:

**Amber Electric**: Full real-time price sync using Amber API.

**Flow Power**: Wholesale electricity with Happy Hour exports. Choose AEMO or Amber pricing.

**Globird**: Static tariff plans with optional AEMO spike export.

**AEMO VPP**: AEMO spike detection for VPP exports (AGL, Engie, etc.).

flow_power_setup.title: Flow Power Configuration
flow_power_setup.description:
Configure your Flow Power settings.

PEA (Price Efficiency Adjustment) uses Flow Power's actual billing model: Final Rate = Base Rate + (Wholesale - 9.7c).

Select your network tariff from the dropdown for fallback rates when PEA is disabled.

data.network_use_manual_rates: Use manual rates instead of automatic lookup
data.pea_custom_value: Custom PEA Override (c/kWh, leave empty for auto)
data.battery_curtailment_enabled: Enable DC Solar Curtailment (stop export at negative prices)

data_description.auto_sync_enabled: Automatically upload TOU tariff schedules to your battery system based on current electricity prices
data_description.battery_curtailment_enabled: Automatically stop battery exports and DC solar production when feed-in prices go negative to avoid paying to export

amber.title: Amber Electric Configuration
amber.description: Enter your Amber Electric API token. You can get this from {amber_url}

amber_settings.title: Amber Settings
amber_settings.description:
Configure spike protection and export boost settings.

Spike protection prevents grid charging during high prices.
Export boost triggers battery exports at lower price points.

data_description.spike_protection_enabled: When Amber detects a price spike, artificially inflate buy prices to prevent your battery from charging from grid
data_description.settled_prices_only: Skip forecast sync at :00 and only sync when actual prices arrive at :35/:60
data_description.forecast_discrepancy_alert: Send mobile notification when predicted forecast differs significantly from conservative forecast (indicates forecast may be unreliable)
data_description.forecast_discrepancy_threshold: Average price difference threshold to trigger alert. Default 10c/kWh means alert when predicted vs conservative differ by more than 10c on average
data_description.force_tariff_mode_toggle: After uploading a new tariff, briefly toggle operation mode to force immediate recalculation (Tesla only)
data_description.export_boost_enabled: Artificially increase sell prices during configured hours to encourage battery export during high-value periods
data_description.export_price_offset: Amount to ADD to the actual Amber export price. Example: Amber=18c + Offset=5c → Tesla sees 23c
data_description.export_min_price: Floor price AFTER offset is applied. Example: Amber=12c + Offset=5c = 17c → bumped up to Floor=20c
data_description.export_boost_threshold: Only apply boost when ACTUAL Amber price (before boost) is at or above this value. Prices below this are sent unchanged. Use 0 to always boost.
data_description.chip_mode_enabled: Suppress exports during configured hours unless price exceeds threshold (inverse of Export Boost)
data_description.chip_mode_threshold: Allow exports only when price is at or above this value

aemo_config.title: AEMO Spike Detection
aemo_config.description:
Configure AEMO wholesale price spike detection. When prices spike above your threshold, your battery will be configured to export energy to the grid.

{threshold_hint}

data_description.aemo_spike_threshold: Default: $3,000/MWh. GloBird spike exports use $3,000/MWh threshold.

octopus.title: Octopus Energy UK Configuration
octopus.description:
Configure your Octopus Energy tariff. Select your product and GSP region.

**Agile Octopus**: Dynamic half-hourly pricing based on wholesale rates.
**Octopus Go**: EV tariff with cheap overnight rates (00:30-05:30).
**Intelligent Octopus Go**: Smart EV/battery tariff with optimised overnight rates.
**Octopus Flux**: Solar/battery optimised import/export tariff.
**Intelligent Octopus Flux**: Smart battery optimised import/export tariff.
**Tracker**: Daily price tracking based on wholesale rates.

Find your GSP region on your Octopus bill or at {octopus_url}

data_description.octopus_region: Your Grid Supply Point region - check your Octopus bill for your GSP code (single letter A-P)

custom_tariff.title: Custom Tariff Configuration

data_description.skip_tariff: Check to use default estimation instead of configuring custom rates
data_description.tariff_type: Flat rate uses a single price all day. Time of Use has different prices for peak, shoulder, and off-peak periods.
data_description.super_offpeak_rate: Optional: For plans with free or cheap solar soak periods (e.g., 10am-2pm)
data_description.super_offpeak_start: Start time of super off-peak period (e.g., 10:00 for solar soak)
data_description.super_offpeak_end: End time of super off-peak period (e.g., 14:00 for solar soak)

battery_system.title: Select Battery System
battery_system.description:
Choose your battery storage system:

**Tesla Powerwall**: Connect via Fleet API or Teslemetry.

**Sigenergy**: Connect via Sigenergy Cloud API.

**Sungrow SH-series**: Connect via Modbus TCP.

**FoxESS**: Connect via Modbus TCP or RS485 serial.

**GoodWe**: Connect via UDP/TCP (ET/EH/ES/EM series hybrid inverters).

optimization_provider.title: Choose Optimization Provider
optimization_provider.description:
Your {battery_name} has built-in battery scheduling. Choose how PowerSync should manage your battery:

**{battery_name} built-in**: Use your battery's native Time-of-Use scheduling.

**Smart Optimization (Built-in LP)**: Uses Linear Programming to find the optimal battery schedule — minimizing costs. No external dependencies required.

ml_options.title: Smart Optimization Settings
ml_options.description:
Configure the backup reserve for the built-in LP optimizer.

The optimizer uses electricity price forecasts, solar generation, and load patterns to find the cost-minimizing charge/discharge schedule.

data_description.optimization_backup_reserve: Minimum battery charge level to maintain (only applies to Smart Optimization)

sungrow.title: Sungrow Modbus Connection
sungrow.description:
Configure the Modbus TCP connection to your Sungrow SH-series hybrid inverter.

Enter the local IP address of your Sungrow inverter or WiNet-S dongle.

data_description.sungrow_host: Local IP address of your Sungrow inverter (e.g., 192.168.1.100)

foxess_connection.title: FoxESS Connection Type
foxess_connection.description:
Choose how to connect to your FoxESS inverter.

**Modbus TCP**: Connect over your local network (LAN/Wi-Fi).

**RS485 Serial**: Direct serial connection for full register access.

foxess_tcp.title: FoxESS Modbus TCP Connection
foxess_tcp.description:
Configure the Modbus TCP connection to your FoxESS inverter.

**H3 Smart**: Has built-in WiFi Modbus — use the inverter's IP address directly (may appear as 'espressif' on your network). Ensure inverter firmware is up to date.

The model family will be auto-detected.

data_description.foxess_host: Local IP address of your FoxESS inverter (e.g., 192.168.1.100)

foxess_serial.title: FoxESS RS485 Serial Connection
foxess_serial.description:
Configure the RS485 serial connection to your FoxESS inverter.

RS485 provides full register access including BMS data and charge periods.

foxess_model.title: Confirm FoxESS Model
foxess_model.description:
Connection successful! Please confirm your inverter model.

Both H3-Pro and H3 Smart use the same register set. The H3 Smart has built-in WiFi Modbus and does not require an external adapter.

foxess_cloud.title: FoxESS Cloud (Optional)
foxess_cloud.description:
Optionally provide your FoxESS Cloud API key to sync Amber/Octopus prices as time-based schedules on your inverter.

Get your API key from **foxesscloud.com > User Profile > API Management**.

This is **not required** for battery control — all control is done locally via Modbus.

Leave blank to skip.

data_description.foxess_cloud_device_sn: Inverter serial number from FoxESS Cloud (optional)

goodwe_connection.title: GoodWe Connection
goodwe_connection.description:
Connect to your GoodWe hybrid inverter. The inverter model will be auto-detected.

**UDP (default):** Port 8899 via WiFi dongle — works with most GoodWe inverters.
**TCP:** Port 502 via LAN dongle.

sigenergy_credentials.title: Sigenergy Credentials
sigenergy_credentials.description:
Enter your Sigenergy Cloud API credentials.

**Password:** Enter your Sigenergy account password.

**Device ID (optional):** Usually not needed. Only required if authentication fails without it. To find it, open browser dev tools (F12), go to Network tab, login to web-aus.sigencloud.com, find the 'token' request payload → userDeviceId.

data_description.sigenergy_pass_enc: Leave blank unless you have a pre-encoded password

sigenergy_station.title: Sigenergy Station
sigenergy_station.description:
Select or enter your Sigenergy Station ID.

If the station list is unavailable, enter your Station ID manually. To find it, ask SigenAI 'Tell me my StationID' in the Sigenergy app.

sigenergy_modbus.title: Sigenergy Modbus Connection
sigenergy_modbus.description:
Configure the Modbus TCP connection to your Sigenergy system.

**Required for energy data:** PowerSync reads real-time solar, battery, and grid power data from your Sigenergy system via Modbus.

Enter the local IP address of your Sigenergy inverter.

data_description.sigenergy_modbus_host: Local IP address of your Sigenergy inverter (e.g., 192.168.1.100)
data_description.sigenergy_modbus_slave_id: Leave at 247 (default). PowerSync auto-detects the correct registers and slave ID.

sigenergy_dc_curtailment.title: Sigenergy DC Solar Curtailment
sigenergy_dc_curtailment.description:
Configure DC solar curtailment for your Sigenergy system.

When enabled, PowerSync can limit DC solar production during negative prices by setting the PV power limit via Modbus.

**Note:** This is for DC solar connected directly to your Sigenergy system. AC-coupled inverters from other brands can be configured separately.

data_description.sigenergy_dc_curtailment_enabled: Allow PowerSync to control DC solar production during negative prices

tesla_provider.title: Choose Tesla API Provider
tesla_provider.description:
{fleet_detected}

Select how you want to access your Tesla Powerwall. Tesla Fleet API is free but requires the Tesla Fleet integration to be installed. Teslemetry is a paid proxy service (~$4/month) that's easier to set up.

teslemetry.title: Teslemetry Configuration
teslemetry.description: Enter your Teslemetry API token. You can get this from {teslemetry_url}

site_selection.title: Site Selection
site_selection.description: Select your Tesla energy site and Amber site (if you have multiple), and configure sync options.

data.battery_curtailment_enabled: Enable DC Solar Curtailment (stop export at negative prices)

data_description.auto_sync_enabled: Automatically upload TOU tariff schedules to your battery system based on current electricity prices
data_description.amber_forecast_type: Which Amber price forecast to use: Predicted (balanced), Low/Aggressive (assumes cheaper prices), High/Conservative (assumes higher prices)
data_description.battery_curtailment_enabled: Automatically stop battery exports and DC solar production when feed-in prices go negative to avoid paying to export

weather_setup.title: Weather & Solar Forecast (Optional)
weather_setup.description:
Configure weather-based automations and solar production forecasting.

**Already using Solcast HA integration?** PowerSync will automatically detect and use your existing Solcast sensors - no API key needed! Just enable Solcast below and leave the API fields blank.

**New to Solcast?** Get a free API key from toolkit.solcast.com.au (10 API calls/day on hobbyist tier).

data.solcast_api_key: Solcast API Key (optional if using Solcast HA integration)
data.solcast_resource_id: Solcast Resource ID(s) (optional if using Solcast HA integration)

data_description.weather_location: Your suburb or city name (e.g., 'Berowra' or 'Melbourne'). For duplicate names, use full state (e.g., 'Berowra, New South Wales'). You can also use a postcode (e.g., '2081') or lat,lon coordinates (e.g., '-33.62,151.15'). Leave blank to auto-detect from timezone.
data_description.openweathermap_api_key: Free API key from openweathermap.org for weather-based automations (sunny/cloudy triggers). Leave blank to disable weather triggers.
data_description.solcast_enabled: Enable solar production forecasting. If the Solcast HA integration is installed, PowerSync will automatically read from its sensors (no API calls). Otherwise, enter your API key below.
data_description.solcast_api_key: Your Solcast API key from toolkit.solcast.com.au. **Leave blank if you have the Solcast HA integration installed** - PowerSync will use its sensors automatically.
data_description.solcast_resource_id: Your rooftop site Resource ID(s). For split arrays, enter comma-separated IDs (e.g., abc123,def456). **Leave blank if using Solcast HA integration.**

demand_charges.title: Demand Charge Configuration (Optional)
demand_charges.description: Configure demand charge tracking for electricity plans with capacity-based fees. Demand charges are applied during peak periods based on your maximum power draw. Leave 'Enable Demand Charge Tracking' unchecked to skip this step.

data.demand_allow_grid_charging: Allow Grid Charging During Demand Windows

data_description.demand_charge_enabled: Track your peak grid draw during demand charge periods and calculate monthly capacity fees based on your highest 30-minute average
data_description.demand_allow_grid_charging: Allow the battery to charge from grid during demand peak periods. When disabled, grid charging is blocked during peak to protect against demand charges.

curtailment_setup.title: Negative FIT Curtailment Settings
curtailment_setup.description:
Configure automatic curtailment during negative feed-in tariff (FIT) prices.

When feed-in prices go negative, you PAY to export power. These settings prevent that by stopping battery export and optionally shutting down solar production.

data_description.battery_curtailment_enabled: Stop battery from exporting to grid when feed-in price is negative. Sets Tesla to self-consumption mode or Sigenergy export limit to 0. This is the MAIN toggle - must be enabled for curtailment to work.
data_description.ac_inverter_curtailment_enabled: Shutdown AC-coupled solar inverter (Fronius, Sungrow, GoodWe, Enphase, etc.) when feed-in price is negative. Use this if your solar bypasses the battery and exports directly to grid. Requires inverter IP configuration in next step.

inverter_brand_setup.title: AC-Coupled Inverter Setup
inverter_brand_setup.description:
Select your solar inverter brand for direct curtailment control.

This allows PowerSync to shut down your AC-coupled solar inverter when feed-in prices are negative.

data_description.inverter_host: Local IP address of your inverter or gateway
data_description.inverter_port: 502 for Modbus (Sungrow, Fronius, GoodWe, Huawei), 443 for Enphase
data_description.inverter_token: Optional if using Enlighten credentials. Manual tokens expire in 12 hours for installer accounts.
data_description.enphase_username: Your Enlighten account email for automatic JWT token refresh (recommended)
data_description.enphase_serial: Leave blank to auto-detect from IQ Gateway
data_description.enphase_normal_profile: Full name of your normal grid profile (for fallback when DPEL/DER unavailable). Example: 'AS/NZS 4777.2:2020 Australia A'
data_description.enphase_zero_export_profile: Full name of a zero-export grid profile if available (for fallback curtailment)
data_description.enphase_is_installer: Enable if using an installer Enlighten account. Required for grid profile switching access.
data_description.inverter_restore_soc: Restore inverter when battery drops below this %. Ensures battery stays topped up before evening peak. Default: 98%
data_description.fronius_load_following: Enable if you DON'T have a 0W export limit configured by your installer. Uses calculated power limits based on home load and auto-detected inverter capacity. Leave OFF if you have the 0W export profile (most users).

battery_management_mode.title: Battery Management Mode
battery_management_mode.description:
Choose how PowerSync should manage your battery:

**Manual**: Use PowerSync automations to control charge/discharge.

**TOU Sync**: Sync prices to battery, let battery's built-in scheduler decide.

**Smart Optimization**: Built-in LP scheduling to minimize costs. No external dependencies required.

data_description.battery_management_mode: Select how PowerSync should manage your battery system
data_description.optimization_backup_reserve: Minimum battery charge level to maintain (20% recommended for backup)

init_sigenergy.title: PowerSync Settings
init_sigenergy.description:
Configure your electricity provider, optimization settings, Sigenergy Modbus connection, and Cloud API credentials.

**Modbus connection is required** to read real-time energy data.
**Cloud API credentials are required** to sync Amber prices to your Sigenergy system.

data_description.sigenergy_device_id: Optional — leave blank unless authentication fails without it

init_sungrow.title: PowerSync Settings
init_sungrow.description:
Configure your electricity provider, optimization settings, and Sungrow Modbus connection.

curtailment_options.title: Curtailment & Weather Settings
curtailment_options.description:
Configure automatic curtailment during negative feed-in tariff (FIT) prices.

When feed-in prices go negative, you PAY to export power. These settings prevent that by stopping battery export and optionally shutting down solar production.

**Weather automations** are independent of curtailment and can be enabled separately below.

data_description.battery_curtailment_enabled: Stop battery from exporting to grid when feed-in price is negative. Sets Tesla to self-consumption mode or Sigenergy export limit to 0. This is the MAIN toggle - must be enabled for curtailment to work.
data_description.ac_inverter_curtailment_enabled: Shutdown AC-coupled solar inverter (Fronius, Sungrow, GoodWe, Enphase, etc.) when feed-in price is negative. Use this if your solar bypasses the battery and exports directly to grid. Requires inverter IP configuration in next step.
data_description.sigenergy_dc_curtailment_enabled: Limit DC solar production via Sigenergy Modbus when feed-in price is negative. Only applies to Sigenergy systems with DC-coupled solar.
data_description.openweathermap_api_key: Free API key from openweathermap.org for weather-based automations (sunny/cloudy triggers). Leave blank to disable weather triggers.

demand_charge_options.title: Network Demand Charges (Optional)
demand_charge_options.description:
Configure demand charge tracking for electricity plans with capacity-based network fees.

Demand charges are based on your peak power draw during specified periods. Your network provider charges a monthly fee based on your highest 30-minute average demand.

Leave 'Enable Demand Charge Tracking' unchecked if your plan does not have demand charges.

data.demand_artificial_price_enabled: Apply Artificial Price During Demand Peak
data.demand_allow_grid_charging: Allow Grid Charging During Demand Windows

data_description.demand_charge_enabled: Track your peak grid draw during demand charge periods and calculate monthly capacity fees based on your highest 30-minute average
data_description.demand_charge_rate: Your network demand charge rate in dollars per kW of peak demand
data_description.demand_charge_start_time: Start time of the demand charge peak measurement period
data_description.demand_charge_end_time: End time of the demand charge peak measurement period
data_description.demand_charge_billing_day: Day of month when the billing cycle resets (1-28)
data_description.demand_charge_apply_to: Whether demand charges apply to grid imports, exports, or both
data_description.demand_artificial_price_enabled: Add an artificial price component during demand peak periods to discourage grid draw
data_description.demand_allow_grid_charging: Allow the battery to charge from grid during demand peak periods. When disabled, grid charging is blocked during peak to protect against demand charges.
data_description.daily_supply_charge: Your daily electricity supply charge for cost tracking
data_description.monthly_supply_charge: Your monthly electricity supply charge for cost tracking

ev_charging_setup.title: EV Charging & OCPP
ev_charging_setup.description:
Configure EV charging and OCPP charger management.

**EV Charging:** Control Tesla vehicles via Fleet API/Teslemetry, Tesla BLE (ESPHome), or Teslemetry Bluetooth.

**OCPP:** Connect OCPP 1.6-compliant chargers.

**Zaptec:** Connect Zaptec chargers via HA integration or standalone (direct Zaptec Cloud API).

data_description.ev_charging_enabled: Allow automations to control Tesla vehicle charging (start/stop, set charge limits, set amps).
data_description.ev_provider: Choose how to control your Tesla: **Fleet API/Teslemetry** uses cloud API, **Tesla BLE** uses local Bluetooth via ESPHome, **Teslemetry Bluetooth** uses native HA Teslemetry Bluetooth integration, **Both** uses local BLE/BT for control with Fleet API fallback.
data_description.tesla_ble_entity_prefix: Entity prefix for Tesla BLE entities (default: tesla_ble). Must match the ESPHome device name. Example: if your entities are sensor.my_tesla_charge_level, enter 'my_tesla'.
data_description.ocpp_enabled: Run an OCPP 1.6J WebSocket server for connecting OCPP-compliant EV chargers. Chargers connect to ws://server:port/'{charger_id}'
data_description.ocpp_port: Port for OCPP WebSocket server (default: 9000). Chargers will connect to this port.
data_description.zaptec_charger_entity: Entity ID of your Zaptec charger (e.g. switch.zaptec_charger). Leave blank if not using Zaptec or if using standalone mode.
data_description.zaptec_installation_id: Zaptec installation device ID for current limiting. Found in the Zaptec integration's device list. Leave blank to auto-detect.
data_description.zaptec_standalone_enabled: Connect directly to Zaptec Cloud API without requiring the custom-components/zaptec HA integration. You will be prompted for your Zaptec account credentials.

zaptec_cloud.title: Zaptec Cloud Credentials
zaptec_cloud.description:
Enter your Zaptec account credentials to connect directly to the Zaptec Cloud API.

PowerSync will auto-discover your chargers and installations.

data_description.zaptec_username: Your Zaptec account email address (same as Zaptec Portal login).

weather_options.title: Weather & Solar Forecast
weather_options.description:
Configure weather-based automations and solar production forecasting.

**Already using Solcast HA integration?** PowerSync will automatically detect and use your existing Solcast sensors - no API key needed! Just enable Solcast below and leave the API fields blank.

data.solcast_api_key: Solcast API Key (optional if using Solcast HA integration)
data.solcast_resource_id: Solcast Resource ID(s) (optional if using Solcast HA integration)

data_description.weather_location: Your suburb or city name (e.g., 'Berowra' or 'Melbourne'). For duplicate names, use full state (e.g., 'Berowra, New South Wales'). You can also use a postcode (e.g., '2081') or lat,lon coordinates (e.g., '-33.62,151.15'). Leave blank to auto-detect from timezone.
data_description.openweathermap_api_key: Free API key from openweathermap.org for weather-based automations (sunny/cloudy triggers). Leave blank to disable weather triggers.
data_description.solcast_enabled: Enable solar production forecasting. If the Solcast HA integration is installed, PowerSync will automatically read from its sensors (no API calls).
data_description.solcast_api_key: Your Solcast API key from toolkit.solcast.com.au. **Leave blank if you have the Solcast HA integration installed.**
data_description.solcast_resource_id: Your rooftop site Resource ID(s). For split arrays, enter comma-separated IDs (e.g., abc123,def456). **Leave blank if using Solcast HA integration.**

sync_tou_schedule.description: Manually trigger a sync of Time-of-Use schedule from Amber to Tesla
